alert.note: Alert for City of Manassas Park; Fauquier (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 16 at 4:28PM EDT until May 16 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT FOR THE SOUTHERN DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA...SOUTHWESTERN PRINCE GEORGES...NORTHWESTERN CHARLES...ARLINGTON...SOUTHEASTERN FAIRFAX... EAST CENTRAL FAUQUIER...AND SOUTHEASTERN PRINCE WILLIAM COUNTIES... THE CITY OF FAIRFAX...THE CITY OF FALLS CHURCH...THE SOUTHEASTERN CITY OF MANASSAS PARK AND THE CITY OF ALEXANDRIA... At 426 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Burke, or near Springfield, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Accokeek and Fort Washington in Maryland are at highest risk. Locations impacted include... Arlington, Alexandria, Centreville, Waldorf, Dale City, Annandale, Clinton, Springfield, Fort Washington, Fairfax, Fort Hunt, Vienna, Groveton, Falls Church, Huntington, Coral Hills, Mantua, Fort Belvoir, Woodbridge and National Harbor. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
